budget2024.title: Union Budget 2024-25 Nirmala Sitharaman to Present Budget for the Seventh Time
budget2024.author: Abhay Patel
budget2024.summary: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman will present the Union Budget for 2024-25 on July 23, 2024.
budget2024.content: Record-Breaking Streak Nirmala Sitharaman's seven consecutive budget presentations surpass the previous record held by Morarji Desai, who presented the budget six times in a row. Desai, however, still holds the record for the most budget presentations overall, having presented ten budgets. Former Finance Minister P. Chidambaram follows with nine presentations, while former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh and Pranab Mukherjee each presented five consecutive budgets. Key Highlight: The Lok Sabha’s business advisory committee has planned discussions on various critical issues including railways, education, health, MSMEs, and food processing, alongside the Union Budget. A total of 20 hours has been allocated for the debate on the budget. Economic Survey 2023-24: The Economic Survey 2023-24, presented on July 22, outlines the state of the economy over the past year and sets the stage for the upcoming budget. Key takeaways from the survey will likely influence the budget's focus and priorities. Stay tuned for the live updates and detailed highlights of the Union Budget 2024-25.

budget2024.title: Nirmala Sitharaman Announces Big Changes in Taxes and Jobs in Budget 2024
budget2024.author: Abhay Patel
budget2024.summary: Analyzing the big changes in taxes and jobs in the 2024 budget.
budget2024.content:
Nirmala Sitharaman Announces Big Changes in Taxes and Jobs in Budget 2024

Abhay Patel

Published on July 23, 2024

Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on July 23 announced her seventh consecutive budget. The presentation on July 23 was the first Budget by the BJP-led NDA government since it was re-elected in June.

Ms. Sitharaman said that the Budget will focus on employment, skilling, MSME and the middle class. An allocation of ₹1.48 lakh crore for education, employment, and skill development was announced.

Budget Priorities

  • Productivity and resilience in agriculture
  • Employment and skilling
  • Inclusive human resource development and social justice
  • Manufacturing and services
  • Support for promotion of MSMEs
  • Urban development
  • Energy security
  • Infrastructure
  • Innovation, research, and development

Agriculture Budget

Ms. Sitharaman announced the initiation of farmers into natural farming, achieving self-sufficiency in pulses and oilseeds, and the development of digital public infrastructure among other measures.

Employment and Education Budget

Three new employee-linked incentive schemes were announced, aligning with the Prime Minister’s package. These schemes focus on the recognition of first-time employees and support for both employers and employees.

Support loans of up to ₹10 lakh for education in domestic institutions will be provided to students who have not yet benefited from any government schemes. E-vouchers for interest subvention of 3% of the loan amount will be given directly to 1 lakh students each year.

A comprehensive scheme was announced for providing internships in 500 top companies to 1 crore youth over 5 years.

Regional Budgets

Bihar and Andhra Pradesh

Several schemes for Bihar were announced as part of the “Purvodaya” plan, including expressways, power projects, new airports, medical colleges, and sports infrastructure. For Andhra Pradesh, funds will be provided under the AP Reorganisation Act to support industrial development and basic infrastructure like water, power, and roads.

Budget for Women

An allocation of over ₹3 lakh crore was made for schemes benefiting women and girls, promoting women-led development.

MSMEs Budget

The Budget provides special attention to MSMEs and labor-intensive manufacturing. A new assessment model for MSME credit by public sector banks will be based on the digital footprint of MSMEs rather than only on assets and turnover criteria.

Personal Income Tax

The finance minister revised the tax slabs under the new regime, allowing a salaried employee to save up to ₹17,500 in income taxes. The slabs have been adjusted as follows:

  • ₹0 to ₹3 lakh: unchanged
  • ₹3 lakh to ₹7 lakh: 5%
  • ₹7 lakh to ₹10 lakh: revised
  • ₹10 lakh to ₹12 lakh: revised
  • ₹12 lakh to ₹15 lakh: revised
  • ₹15 lakh and above: revised
